revised_title: Differences in the Directions of Ejection of X-Ray Photo-Electrons from Various Atomic Levels
tldr: The authors conducted experiments using a magnetic spectrograph to study the directions and velocities of X-ray photo-electrons ejected from various atomic levels. They found that the distribution of photo-electrons from the L and M levels is more isotropic than that of the K and Li levels, and the average forward momentum of L and M electrons is greater than that of K and Li electrons.
